subject: AI & Agents
title: The Productivity Paradox: More AI, Same Growth?
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Productivity Paradox: More AI, Same Growth? usable.

hook.text: We have the most powerful AI in history, yet economic productivity growth remains stubbornly slow.

buildup.text: The same paradox happened with computers in the 1980s ‚Äî Nobel economist Solow noted it first.

discovery.text: New technologies take decades to reshape workflows, organizations, and skills before productivity surges.

twist.text: Electricity took 30 years to boost factory output. AI adoption may follow a similar slow curve.

climax.text: The productivity gains from AI may be enormous ‚Äî but they're coming later than the hype suggests.

punchline.text: Revolutionary technology, evolutionary adoption. Patience, humanity.

quiz.question: Why haven't AI productivity gains appeared immediately in economic data?
options: New technologies take decades to reshape workflows and organizations
